class_notes:
This course will be taught entirely online and will meet synchronously both days.


This course examines the nature, causes, prosecution, experience, outcomes, and termination of wars.  It addresses a number of topics, such as counterinsurgency, civil wars, gender and conflict, peacekeeping, domestic politics and war, violence against civilians during wartime, drone strikes, covert action, military robotics, cyberconflict, and others.  The class is online and completely synchronous.  The course satisfies the political science and international studies research requirement, and requires a major research paper.  It is highly recommended that students enrolled in this course have taken POLS 110 and POLS 208.
course_description: This class covers a variety of topics regarding the nature, causes, prosecution, and consequences of war. Specific topics discussed include counterinsurgency, deterrence, public opinion and war, economic development and war, democracy and war, civil-military relations, civil war, ethnicity and war.
prerequisites: POLS 110 or POLS_OX 110 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
